captions.text: crowd murmurs
I call this session to order with the drums of freedom!
I second your motion with the guitar of liberty!
Not to be outdone, I will administer the bassline of justice!
I am pointing to the emu of elf excretion.
Will the gentleman rise to sing a plaintive melody?
Dont leave me swinging in the wind until November
I am here! I am not going away!
Hey, if I was you, I may want me to go away, too
You know, what the hell--do what you have to do
But dont leave me swinging in the wind until November!
Dont leave me swinging in the wind! The wiiiind!
Democrats, hey! And Republicans, hey!
As much as I love you, I am not going away
I violated the rules and Im apologizing
For Gods sake, Im 80 years old
And all Im saying is heck,
Have the ethics committee expedite this--
This is an emergency
Democrats, hey! And Republicans, hey!
As much as I love you, I am not going away
Hes still a contender!
He will not surrender!
Dont you leave him
Swinging in the wind until November
Dont leave me swinging in the wind until November!
Dont leave me swinging in the wiiiind...
Do what you have to do
But dont leave me swinging in the wind until November! Until November!
Dont leave me swinging in the wind! the wiiiiind
Dance Break!
THE GENTLEMAN WILL SIT!
YES!
INSTEAD OF STANDING UP!
NO!
THE GENTLEMAN WILL SIT!
LET'S GO!
THE GENTLEMAN IS CORRECT IN SITTING!
HOLD THAT SEAT!
THE GENTLEMAN WILL OBSERVE REGULAR ORDER!
AND SIT DOWN!
LEFT, RIGHT!
DOWN!
-UP! -DOWN!
AND SPIN AROUND!
Theres a lot of pain and anguish
from people worried about this Islamic center.
What about these strip joints?
Are these people who are holier than thou
condemning the strip joints that are nearby?
-Alright, fair enough. -Yeah! -Fair enough.
Let's take a closer look at the strippers
To see if they got somethin to hide...OH YEAH!
Painting Islam with a broad brush
makes our problems worse, worse, worse!
Makes them worse!
And I dont like it, nobody should like it.
Painting strip joints with a broad brush
makes our problems worse, worse, worse, -much worse!
It was done to the Jews before
That's why we have perpetual war.
-Blood and gore!  -Perpetual War!
-Forevermore! -Perpetual War!
Persecutin Islamic Strippers!
I dont like it.
Puttin a ban on halal liquor!
Nobody should like it.
Burnin Qurans to get people pissed!
I dont like it.
Puttin Tinky Winky on the no-fly list!
Nobody should like it.
Republicans drove our economy into a ditch.
We got in there, and we pushed and we shoved!
And these guys were standing
Sippin on a slurpee.
And then they got the nerve
to ask for the keys back!
I dont wanna give em the keys back!
They don't know how to drive!
If you wanna go forward in your car
what do you do? You put it in D -
theyre gonna pop it in reverse!
I don't wanna give em the keys back!
They dont know how to drive!
Our metaphorical car
got no brakes and no gear shift!
Well go metaphorically far
While were standin in the ditch!
Bitch!

comments.author: GruntGroupGuys

comments.text:
+GruntGroupGuys Your personal experience is irrelevant to discussing the 
economy. The only things that matter are facts and data.

The economy is in much better health than it was in 2008. Stock indexes are 
uniformly up, as are home prices, the GDP, industrial production, etc. Job 
growth is sluggish, but that's completely expected coming out of a 
recession. Debt is an issue--putting two wars on a largely Chinese credit 
card and slashing taxes on the rich is, as it turns out, a bad idea--but 
it's not really much of an issue, and austerity is a terrible solution. 
National debt isn't household debt, they don't work the same way at all, 
and America has been borrowing less from abroad since 2008 than it has in 
decades. The real concern is the decline in median household income, which 
is a systemic and nonpartisan problem relating to the age of the workforce 
and systematic changes in the makeup of our economy. Look for both 
household income and unemployment to shift as the boomers continue to 
retire, but I wouldn't count on the former going up as the latter goes 
down. The transition to a service and subsequently a knowledge economy has 
left us without a middle class structure, and NOBODY knows how to solve 
that yet. We may even bridge to post-sufficiency in the next century, but 
our collective apparent loathing of the welfare state makes us uniquely 
ill-suited to it.
comments.author: Ted Hendershot
